greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals: A(n,k) = number of permutations of n elements divided by the number of k-ary heaps on n+1 elements, n>=0, k>=1.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, k) option remember; local h, i, x, y, z;
if n<2 then 1 elif k<2 then k
if y<=z and z<=x then b(y, k)^(k-1-i)*
mathematica: multinomial[n_, k_List] := n!/Times @@ (k!); b[n_, k_] := b[n, k] = Module[{h, i, x, y, z}, Which[n<2, 1, k<2, k, True, h = Floor @ Log[k, (k - 1)*n + 1]; If [k^h == (k-1)*n+1, b[(n-1)/k, k]^k*multinomial[n-1, Array[(n-1)/k&, k]], {x, y} = {(k^h-1)/(k-1), (k^(h-1)-1)/(k-1)}; For[i = 0, True, i++, z = (n-1) - (k-1-i)*y - i*x; If[y <= z && z <= x, b[y, k]^(k-1-i)*multinomial[n-1, Join[Array[y&, k-1-i], Array[x&, i], {z}]] * b[x, k]^i*b[z, k] // Return]]]]]; A[n_, k_] :=  n!/b[n+1, k]; Table[A[n, 1+d-n], {d, 0, 14}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 13 2017, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 28 2016
